result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian W Fulkerson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated 11/22/16 from DOJ requesting copies from the file. (copies returned 11/23/16)
To appear, drafted by Atty David Raihle Jr

Attorney David H Raihle in court.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case settlement reached.  16CM34 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea of NC in 15TR1439, Fine of $811.50, 6 month revocation of DL, AODA/Safety assessment, 6 points on driving record.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.    Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.
Review hearing on August 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney David H Raihle in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not appear.  $500.00 sign bond, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores,   Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Track 15TR1439 along.  Set for RH 8-23-16 @ 9:00AM.  DE to come sign bond.
